subSections.subSectionTitle: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples

keyPoints.point: Australia’s first inhabitants are the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.
Aboriginal people are from mainland Australia and Tasmania.
Aboriginal peoples arrived in Australia between 65,000 and 40,000 years ago.
Torres Strait Islander people are from islands between the northern tip of Queensland and Papua New Guinea.
European settlement started when the first 11 convict ships, which became known as the ‘First Fleet’, arrived from Great Britain on 26 January 1788.
The first Governor of the colony of New South Wales was Captain Arthur Phillip.
Early free settlers came from Great Britain and Ireland. This British and Irish heritage has had a major influence on Australia’s recent history, culture and politics.
